Audio Description: A stern looking soldier is staring intently at the viewer of this World War II poster that encourages car-pooling to save gasoline for the war effort. The soldier is wearing an un-strapped helmet as the sky behind him is darkening from blue to black. His eyes are highlighted in a yellow light and his face is dirty from combat. The text of the poster is in composed of light green capital letters that stand out against the dark poster. The text that is printed above and below the face of the soldier poses the question: “Have you really tried to save gas by getting into a car club?”
Creator: United States. Office of Price Administration
Description: Poster, 71 x 51 cm, artist: Harold Von Schmidt
Rights: Materials in this collection are made available by the Illinois State Library. To request reproductions or inquire about permissions, contact:  islimg@ilsos.net. Please cite the item title and collection name.
